intro: Sageretia tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet and adjacent areas in China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in early summer. Sageretia tibetica is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting resistance to cold and strong winds. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
